ref: 982 ásthi n. ʻ bone ʼ, nom. acc. sg. ásthi, other cases ásthan- RV. [See aṣṭhi -- ]

lang: Aśokan, i.e. the language of the Inscriptions of Aśoka
ref: kb. anathika -- mache ʻ boneless fish ʼ (Hultzsch reads anaṭhika -- with all other versions, see aṣṭhi -- );
kb. anathika -- mache ʻ boneless fish ʼ (Hultzsch reads anaṭhika -- with all other versions, see aṣṭhi -- );
Pk. atthi -- , ˚ya -- n. ʻ bone, a kind of fruit with many seeds ʼ;
Si. äta -- midaḷu ʻ marrow of the bones ʼ.
